entity.name: `<datalist>`
entity.description: Method of providing a list of presets for a user to select in a form control, while still allowing custom options.
entity.descriptionClean: Method of providing a list of presets for a user to select in a form control, while still allowing custom options.

example.codeHighlighted: <input name="country" list="countries"> <datalist id="countries"> <option>Afghanistan</option> ... </datalist>

webFeature.description_html: The <datalist> element sets recommended values for an <input> element. Browsers may show a dropdown menu of all values or match values as the user types.
webFeature.name: <datalist>

entity.name: DX
entity.description: Learnability, API ergonomics (DX), cognitive overhead, things being too low-level, confusing, annoying, or a hassle.
entity.descriptionClean: Learnability, API ergonomics (DX), cognitive overhead, things being too low-level, confusing, annoying, or a hassle.

entity.name: High effort
entity.description: Requires too much work. Includes APIs being too low-level, requiring a lot of manual developer effort to use.
entity.descriptionClean: Requires too much work. Includes APIs being too low-level, requiring a lot of manual developer effort to use.

entity.name: Poor learnability
entity.description: High learning curve, requires too much knowledge to get started, or too much information to memorize.
entity.descriptionClean: High learning curve, requires too much knowledge to get started, or too much information to memorize.

entity.name: Excessive verbosity / Boilerplate

entity.description: Too much complexity
entity.descriptionClean: Too much complexity

entity.name: Difficulty managing ids
entity.description: Difficulties around creating and managing unique ids, linking to ids, etc.
entity.descriptionClean: Difficulties around creating and managing unique ids, linking to ids, etc.

entity.name: Form validation
entity.description: Set of HTML attributes and JS APIs to facilitate client-side form validation (`<input pattern>`, `<input required>`, `input. setCustomValidity(msg)` etc)
entity.descriptionHtml: Set of HTML attributes and JS APIs to facilitate client-side form validation (<input pattern>, <input required>, input. setCustomValidity(msg) etc)
entity.descriptionClean: Set of HTML attributes and JS APIs to facilitate client-side form validation (<input pattern>, <input required>, input. setCustomValidity(msg) etc)

example.codeHighlighted: <input id="zip" pattern="[0-9]{5}" title="5 digits" required />

entity.name: Validation Errors
entity.description: Pain points related to the UA-generated validation errors. For issues with styling and customizing the content of built-in error messages, combine with `styling_customization` or its descendants.
entity.descriptionHtml: Pain points related to the UA-generated validation errors. For issues with styling and customizing the content of built-in error messages, combine with styling_customization or its descendants.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points related to the UA-generated validation errors. For issues with styling and customizing the content of built-in error messages, combine with styling_customization or its descendants.

entity.name: Cross-Field Validation
entity.description: Difficulties in implementing validation logic where the validity of one field depends on the value of another field.
entity.descriptionClean: Difficulties in implementing validation logic where the validity of one field depends on the value of another field.

entity.name: Validation API
entity.description: Issues with the programmatic aspects of the Constraint Validation API (e.g., `setCustomValidity()`).
entity.descriptionHtml: Issues with the programmatic aspects of the Constraint Validation API (e.g., setCustomValidity()).
entity.descriptionClean: Issues with the programmatic aspects of the Constraint Validation API (e.g., setCustomValidity()).

entity.name: Interop issues
entity.description: Browser support issues, implementation bugs, crossbrowser implementation differences or inconsistencies, browser prioritization, speed of adoption of new features, any issues where specific browsers, browser engines, or browser companies are mentioned (and its not to praise them).
entity.descriptionClean: Browser support issues, implementation bugs, crossbrowser implementation differences or inconsistencies, browser prioritization, speed of adoption of new features, any issues where specific browsers, browser engines, or browser companies are mentioned (and its not to praise them).

entity.name: Customizable Select
entity.description: Stylable, customizable dropdown control. Previously `<selectlist>` and `<selectmenu>`.
entity.descriptionHtml: Stylable, customizable dropdown control. Previously <selectlist> and <selectmenu>.
entity.descriptionClean: Stylable, customizable dropdown control. Previously <selectlist> and <selectmenu>.

resources.title: The selectmenu HTML Tag | CSS-Tricks - CSS-Tricks
Advanced Form Control Styling With Selectmenu And Anchoring API  Smashing Magazine

webFeature.description_html: The <select> element's appearance, including the button, selected option, picker dropdown, and options, can be customized using CSS.
webFeature.name: Customizable <select>

entity.name: Accessibility
entity.description: Accessibility improvements
entity.descriptionClean: Accessibility improvements

entity.name: Input Masking
entity.description: The lack of a native feature for formatting user input in real-time, such as for phone numbers or currency.
entity.descriptionClean: The lack of a native feature for formatting user input in real-time, such as for phone numbers or currency.

entity.name: Input Groups (Prefix/Suffix)
entity.description: Pain points related to the inability to declaratively add prefixes or suffixes (text or icons) inside or alongside an input field, such as for currency symbols or units.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points related to the inability to declaratively add prefixes or suffixes (text or icons) inside or alongside an input field, such as for currency symbols or units.

entity.name: Missing elements
entity.description: The need to build common UI patterns from scratch due to the lack of built-in, accessible HTML elements.
entity.descriptionClean: The need to build common UI patterns from scratch due to the lack of built-in, accessible HTML elements.

entity.name: Switch Control
entity.description: The lack of a native switch or toggle control, forcing developers to build one from a checkbox.
entity.descriptionClean: The lack of a native switch or toggle control, forcing developers to build one from a checkbox.

entity.name: Carousel
entity.description: The lack of a native, declarative HTML element for creating carousels or sliders, forcing developers to build them from scratch.
entity.descriptionClean: The lack of a native, declarative HTML element for creating carousels or sliders, forcing developers to build them from scratch.

entity.name: Tabs element
entity.description: Pain points from the lack of a native HTML element for tabbed interfaces, a common UI pattern.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points from the lack of a native HTML element for tabbed interfaces, a common UI pattern.

entity.name: Reliance on JavaScript
entity.description: Excessive reliance on JavaScript
entity.descriptionClean: Excessive reliance on JavaScript

entity.name: Editing APIs

entity.descriptionClean: Pain points related to APIs for text editing.

entity.description: Issues around the difficulties using or implementing in-page markdown editors, whether that is via contentEditable, textareas, or other methods.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues around the difficulties using or implementing in-page markdown editors, whether that is via contentEditable, textareas, or other methods.

entity.description: Issues around the difficulties using or implementing in-page editable code areas, or wishes there was a native code editor element.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues around the difficulties using or implementing in-page editable code areas, or wishes there was a native code editor element.

entity.name: End-user experience
entity.description: Issues around difficulties providing a good user experience for end-users. Do not include DX issues here (use `ergonomics` for that).
entity.descriptionHtml: Issues around difficulties providing a good user experience for end-users. Do not include DX issues here (use ergonomics for that).
entity.descriptionClean: Issues around difficulties providing a good user experience for end-users. Do not include DX issues here (use ergonomics for that).

entity.name: Specific platforms & vendors
entity.description: Issues mentioning specific platforms, operating systems, or browser vendors.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues mentioning specific platforms, operating systems, or browser vendors.

entity.name: Apple
entity.description: Issues specific to Apple as a platform or vendor, and the Apple ecosystem (e.g., Safari, WebKit, iOS).
entity.descriptionClean: Issues specific to Apple as a platform or vendor, and the Apple ecosystem (e.g., Safari, WebKit, iOS).

entity.name: Microsoft
entity.description: Issues specific to Microsoft as a platform or vendor.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues specific to Microsoft as a platform or vendor.

entity.name: Low quality results
entity.description: Fidelity issues that are outside the developers control or API limitations making it hard to produce high-fidelity results. E.g. rendering is too low quality, low dpi, blurry, browser-generated UI is poor or ugly, etc.
entity.descriptionClean: Fidelity issues that are outside the developers control or API limitations making it hard to produce high-fidelity results. E.g. rendering is too low quality, low dpi, blurry, browser-generated UI is poor or ugly, etc.

entity.name: Rendering
entity.description: General issues related to the browser's process of painting pixels on the screen, including layout, style recalculation, and compositing.
entity.descriptionHtml: General issues related to the browser's process of painting pixels on the screen, including layout, style recalculation, and compositing.
entity.descriptionClean: General issues related to the browser's process of painting pixels on the screen, including layout, style recalculation, and compositing.

entity.description: The need for or issues with techniques for rendering long lists or large tables by only rendering the visible items (virtual scrolling).
entity.descriptionClean: The need for or issues with techniques for rendering long lists or large tables by only rendering the visible items (virtual scrolling).

entity.name: Form-Associated Custom Elements
entity.description: Issues related to creating and using Form-Associated Custom Elements (FACE) and issues around form participation and semantics for web components.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues related to creating and using Form-Associated Custom Elements (FACE) and issues around form participation and semantics for web components.

entity.descriptionClean: Issues related to the ElementInternals APIs.

entity.descriptionClean: Pain points related to preserving form state on navigation and in any other cases.

entity.descriptionClean: Issues around compatibility with JS frameworks.

entity.descriptionClean: Issues around compatibility with React.

entity.descriptionClean: The lack of a native range input that supports multiple thumbs or handles, for selecting a min/max range.

entity.name: Education

entity.descriptionClean: Issues related to learning new technologies

entity.name: Lack of documentation
entity.description: Lack of documentation or code examples
entity.descriptionClean: Lack of documentation or code examples

entity.name: Declarative APIs
entity.description: Complaints about lack of declarative APIs (combine with `limitations`), or current declarative APIs (as a whole) being hard to use (combine with `ergonomics`).

entity.descriptionClean: Issues relevant to specific environments or consumers of web content, e.g. devices, bots, viewing modes, etc.

entity.description: Challenges around supporting both mobile and desktop, but not specifically about either of the two.
entity.descriptionClean: Challenges around supporting both mobile and desktop, but not specifically about either of the two.

entity.description: Issues related to styling and controlling the printing of web pages, including paged media features.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues related to styling and controlling the printing of web pages, including paged media features.

entity.description: Issues around server-client integration & communication, server-side rendering, etc.

entity.descriptionClean: Issues around server-client integration & communication, server-side rendering, etc.

entity.description: Performance bottlenecks related to the process of making server-rendered HTML interactive on the client using JavaScript frameworks.

entity.name: CSS Anchor Positioning
entity.description: Pain points related to the CSS Anchor Positioning API, often in conjunction with the Popover API. Includes issues with browser support and the perceived necessity of this API for positioning popovers and tooltips effectively.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points related to the CSS Anchor Positioning API, often in conjunction with the Popover API. Includes issues with browser support and the perceived necessity of this API for positioning popovers and tooltips effectively.

entity.name: Top Layer
entity.description: Issues related to the top layer, where elements like <dialog> and popovers are rendered. Includes z-index conflicts, stacking order control, and interactions between multiple top-layer elements.
entity.descriptionHtml: Issues related to the top layer, where elements like  and popovers are rendered. Includes z-index conflicts, stacking order control, and interactions between multiple top-layer elements.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues related to the top layer, where elements like  and popovers are rendered. Includes z-index conflicts, stacking order control, and interactions between multiple top-layer elements.

entity.description: Pain points related to specific CSS values and units.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points related to specific CSS values and units.

entity.descriptionClean: General issues related to CSS layout models.

entity.descriptionClean: Lack of security and privacy

entity.name: Invalid/Spam
entity.description: Nonsense or nonactionable or off-topic content.
entity.descriptionClean: Nonsense or nonactionable or off-topic content.

entity.name: Shadow DOM
entity.description: Encapsulate elements not visible from the outside, and style them with CSS not affecting the rest of the page.
entity.descriptionClean: Encapsulate elements not visible from the outside, and style them with CSS not affecting the rest of the page.

example.codeHighlighted: this.shadowRoot = this.attachShadow({mode: "open"});

webFeature.description_html: Shadow DOM allows you to attach encapsulated "shadow" DOM trees to elements. A shadow DOM tree is a separate component, isolated from the scripts and styles in other parts of the document. This is a part of Web Components.
webFeature.name: Shadow DOM

entity.descriptionClean: Desire for native/standardized HTMLMarkdown conversion

entity.description: Issues related to understanding, choosing, and correctly using semantically appropriate HTML elements.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues related to understanding, choosing, and correctly using semantically appropriate HTML elements.

entity.description: Issues related to the lack of native HTML elements for semantic footnotes and endnotes.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues related to the lack of native HTML elements for semantic footnotes and endnotes.

entity.description: Crashes, device/context loss, flaky behavior, and error handling.
entity.descriptionClean: Crashes, device/context loss, flaky behavior, and error handling.

entity.descriptionClean: Issues around getting ones workplace to agree on certain policies and/or priorities.

entity.description: Debugging issues
entity.descriptionClean: Debugging issues

entity.name: `popover` attribute (Popover API)
entity.description: HTML syntax and JS API facilitating popovers such as overlays, popups, menus etc.
entity.descriptionClean: HTML syntax and JS API facilitating popovers such as overlays, popups, menus etc.

example.code: Popover content
example.codeHighlighted: <button popovertarget="foo">Toggle the popover</button> <div id="foo" popover>Popover content</div>

resources.title: The Popover API (previously Popup)  Issue #743  w3ctag/design-reviews  GitHub

webFeature.description_html: The popover HTML attribute creates an overlay to display content on top of other page content. Popovers can be shown declaratively using HTML, or using the showPopover() method.
webFeature.name: Popover

entity.description: Issues around third party tools, or lack thereof, including tooling in the browser (extensions, devtools, etc.).
entity.descriptionClean: Issues around third party tools, or lack thereof, including tooling in the browser (extensions, devtools, etc.).

entity.description: Performance issues

entity.descriptionClean: Lack of templating

entity.name: Not applicable

entity.descriptionClean: No use cases, no pain, no issues.

entity.name: Vendor politics
entity.description: Pain points arising from the strategic decisions, priorities, or market position of browser vendors or platform owners (e.g. Apple, Google).
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points arising from the strategic decisions, priorities, or market position of browser vendors or platform owners (e.g. Apple, Google).

entity.name: `<dialog>`
entity.description: Creates a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.
entity.descriptionClean: Creates a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.

example.code:
<dialog id="confirm">
	<form method="dialog">
		Are you sure?
		<button value="1">Yes</button>
		<button value="0">No</button>
	</form>
</dialog>
example.codeHighlighted: <dialog id="confirm"> <form method="dialog"> Are you sure? <button value="1">Yes</button> <button value="0">No</button> </form> </dialog>

webFeature.description_html: The <dialog> HTML element represents a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.
webFeature.name: <dialog>

entity.name: Specific platform APIs & capabilities
entity.description: Pain points around APIs opening access to native capabilities, like the Clipboard API, the File System API, etc.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points around APIs opening access to native capabilities, like the Clipboard API, the File System API, etc.

entity.name: Signals
entity.description: Desire for a native implementation of the Signals pattern for fine-grained reactivity.
entity.descriptionClean: Desire for a native implementation of the Signals pattern for fine-grained reactivity.

entity.name: macOS
entity.description: Issues specific to macOS as a platform.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues specific to macOS as a platform.

entity.name: <details>/<summary>
entity.description: Pain points related to the <details> and <summary> elements, including styling limitations (especially the marker), animation difficulties, and accessibility concerns.

entity.descriptionClean: Pain points related to the  and  elements, including styling limitations (especially the marker), animation difficulties, and accessibility concerns.

entity.descriptionHtml: Pain points in using UI transitions & animations, the View Transitions API, etc.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points in using UI transitions & animations, the View Transitions API, etc.

entity.name: Discrete Animations
entity.description: Pain points related to animating discrete properties (like `display` or `visibility`), often in the context of entry/exit animations for elements like `<details>` or popovers.
entity.descriptionHtml: Pain points related to animating discrete properties (like display or visibility), often in the context of entry/exit animations for elements like <details> or popovers.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points related to animating discrete properties (like display or visibility), often in the context of entry/exit animations for elements like <details> or popovers.

entity.name: Loading
entity.description: General issues related to loading page subresources like scripts, stylesheets, and modules, preloading, or loading UX.
entity.descriptionClean: General issues related to loading page subresources like scripts, stylesheets, and modules, preloading, or loading UX.

entity.name: `<dialog closedby="any">`
entity.description: Allows the dialog to be closed by clicking outside of it (light dismiss).
entity.descriptionClean: Allows the dialog to be closed by clicking outside of it (light dismiss).

webFeature.description_html: The closedby HTML attribute for <dialog> sets which user actions close a dialog. For example, closedby="any" allows the dialog to be closed by clicking outside of it.
webFeature.name: <dialog closedby>

entity.name: HTML Modules
entity.description: Import HTML files via JS imports and access their elements and JS exports.
entity.descriptionClean: Import HTML files via JS imports and access their elements and JS exports.

example.code:
<script type="module">
	import { TabList } from "./tablist.html" with { type: 'html' };
	customElements.define("tab-list", TabList);
</script>
example.codeHighlighted: <script type="module"> import { TabList } from "./tablist.html" with { type: 'html' }; customElements.define("tab-list", TabList); </script>
